competitors.name: Juniper Networks
competitors.notes: Launched M40 backbone router in 1998, gained 30% of SP market share by 2000

competitors.name: Nortel Networks
competitors.notes: Major rival in network equipment market, distant No. 2 or No. 3 to Cisco in enterprise networking

competitors.name: Lucent Technologies
competitors.notes: Top three competitors in the network equipment market

competitors.name: 3Com
competitors.notes: Enterprise rival competing in routing and switching

competitors.name: Bay Networks
competitors.notes: Formed from merger of SynOptics and Wellfleet, later acquired by Nortel

competitors.name: Cabletron
competitors.notes: Enterprise rival in routing and switching markets

context: In 2000, Cisco was at the height of the dot-com bubble and became the most valuable company in the world with market cap over $500 billion. It was 'Cisco vs. everybody else' in the network equipment market.
